result.execSummary:
One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. James W Noyd is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James W Noyd

Referral to Dane County Bail Monitoring (DCBM)

- The court orders a signature bond in the amount of $500.00 per case on the condition that the defendant reports to, and complies with, Dane County Bail Monitoring (DCBM).  The defendant shall report to DCBM by 4:00 pm today.  If the defendant fails to comply with DCBM, a body only bench warrant shall be issued for the defendant's arrest and the defendant shall be held in custody until bail is reviewed by the court.
- Defendant shall be within their residence between the hours of 9:30 p.m. and 6:00 a.m. unless accompanied by a parent or legal guardian or unless at, or traveling to or from, school, treatment, or employment as approved by BMP in writing.
- Defendant shall not use or possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
- Defendant shall not threaten or direct any acts of physical violence against Pamela N.
- Defendant shall not be at any pawn shops or resale stores.
- Defendant shall cooperate and follow all rules of the Dane County Drug Court Diversion Program.
